title: Saturday Studio: Kameelah Janan Rasheed and Legibility's Edge (Nov 18)
short_description: Take inspiration from the text-based work of artist Kameelah Janan Rasheed and make found poems using Dada-inspired text collage techniques.
description:
In this Saturday Studio, take inspiration from the text-based work in Kameelah Janan Rasheed: Unsewn Time and make found poems using Dada-inspired collage techniques. Guided by artist d. Wright, attendees will sift through texts written or provided by the artist to compose cut-up poems.

Through this exercise, participants are invited to consider the show's key themes of gathering and dispersing as well as the artist’s interest in exploring alternative systems of reading, writing, and learning.

Please note that this is an in-person event that takes place at the museum.

In accordance with state and City of Chicago guidelines, visitors to the museum are no longer required to wear masks or provide proof of vaccination. Anyone who would like to continue to wear a mask is welcome to do so. Learn more about our visiting policies and what to expect.

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.
